text: Ronald P. Toby (1942 -- ) is an American historian, academic, writer and Japan studies expert. ==Early life== Toby earned a doctorate in Japanese history from Columbia University in 1977.University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign; Department of East Asian Languages and Culture ; retrieved 2013-3-23. ==Career== Toby has been a history professor at the University of California at Berkeley, Keio University and the University of Tokyo.Press release: "First Japanese Diplomatic Mission to U.S. Is Subject of May 24 Lecture," Library of Congress, April 16, 2010. ==Select works== In an overview of writings by and about Toby, OCLC/WorldCat lists roughly 18 works in 30+ publications in 3 languages and 790+ library holdings.
